Reviews.Title: charging  disaster
Reviews.Author: P. COOK "cokp"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a replacement while on vacation.  After less than a month it would not charge.  When I contacted customer support I was told I needed a new battery because most likely I had overcharged the camera and should not leave it charging more that 2 hours.  I purchased a new battery and  it worked ok for 2 months.  I removed the memory card to upload photos to my computer and now the Nikon S4100 won't power up again.  Not work the trouble to get yet another battery.  The Casio Exilm I lost was much, much better.

Reviews.Title: Great, Easy-To-Use Camera
Reviews.Author: aab003
Reviews.Content: I have been really happy with this camera. The first one I ordered stopped charging correctly after the first day, but I was able to send it back for a replacement, and my new one has been working great. Sure, the night pictures aren't the best, but you're not going to find much better in a camera in this price range.The camera turns on very fast which I like, however if you're using flash sometimes you have to wait a bit before you can take the next picture. I also had some trouble with blurry pictures at first, but I discovered the non-hand shake mode and once it was turned on my camera took great pictures.I really like the simplicity of the buttons, especially the video record button. While it takes a couple seconds to actually start recording, it's fun to just be able to hit the record button to start a video. Some people had problems with the touch screen, but I think it works great. My phone is also a touch screen so I may just be used to how to use them, but I think it is very responsive.  Plus, I think the plum color of the actual camera looks really good.While the camera does have a few time-to-shoot issues (which is why I give it a 4 and not a 5), all in all, I think it's a great, fun camera for this price range.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pics and great price!!
Reviews.Author: Ayleen Allmand
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera! I haven't finished reading the user manual because it has so many features. I went to Universal Orlando and everyone was impressed with not only how easy it was to use the camera but how beautiful the colors were. The zoom feature is great. The best part is how large the screen is. It is so slim and I love the stylus that comes with the camera so you can see your pics. The only problem I had was that I didn't purchase a memory card so after 4 pics, I had no memory left and had to purchase a memory card at the park (ouch at the price!!) I would highly recommend this camera to everyone who is looking for an affordable yet high quality, beautiful pics!!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy if you want reliability
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: I bought the S4100 3 weeks ago to take on a vacation to europe. It looked small and had a touch screen and the picture quality was ok. I wasn't looking for anything special.Out of the box the touchscreen seemed unresponsive but once again not a deal breaker. I had a small camera with a solid zoom and decent MegaPixel qualityHowever, I stand here 3 weeks and day later in Rome with a useless hunk of junk.First it started with the lens errors. Then the battery became exhausted even though it was showing that I had a full battery. I took pristine care of this camera and made sure that I never charged it too long or let it drop anywhere.Now the battery won't charge and the camera won't turn on. Absolute lemon and if you don't believe me read through some of these other reviews and you will notice a theme.Save yourself the time and trouble.

Reviews.Title: Nikon has the worst customer/warranty service
Reviews.Author: MD Man
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my wife. She used it one time and the second time she wanted to use it the screen turned cloudy and then went completely blackSent it back to Nikon under warranty and it was returned saying that it was a moisture issue and that it was not covered but they would gladly repair it for $100I informed them that the camera was never in a moist enviroment that would cause an issueand stated that if moisture caused an issue under normal use than that would be a defectI have a Canon PowerShot that is over 7 years old and has been subjected to rain, snow, beaches,ocean travel, and tropical climates and have never had an issue.The Nikon Coolpix was used at a wedding and then attempted to take photos in San Antonio TX on a cloudy day... Hardly extream moisture enviroments that would cause damage to a supposedly high quality cameraIn my opinion Nikon is a use once and throw away camera as the company does not honor it's waranty and uses their waranty service to charge more than what the camera is worth for repairs

Reviews.Title: Easy-to-use camera
Reviews.Author: Mysterious Reviewer
Reviews.Content: My kids found this camera on sale and convinced me to purchase it. I am glad I did as compared to the old HP camera, which I loved, this camera is far superior when it comes to ease-of-use. What I most love about this camera is the rechargeable power supply which means I do not have to purchase batteries. As the old HP digital camera was a battery hog, the Nikon is a winner when it comes to this feature.I also like how easy it is to select the functions you would like to use when readying to take a photo. The back of the camera has a touch screen that displays the functions you can choose from. I have older fingers so I do use the attached stylus to choose the function I want to use.When setting up the photo a grid is displayed to help guide you in selecting the correct perspective meaning those photos will come out looking professional.My only complaint is sometimes, for whatever reason, some of the photos tend to come out a bit fuzzy. Perhaps it's the photographer and not the camera we'll never know :-)Very pleased with this purchase and this is a great little camera for daily use.Recommend.

Reviews.Title: piss off
Reviews.Author: solomon
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for a friend's birthday and within a weeks time after the battery die she was not able to charge the camera. She had to ship it back to Nikon and now it's closes to a month and she still has not recieve it back. I wouldn't purchase this model because the charging port is on the camera. So if that goes your camera is down for the count.

Reviews.Title: Touch screen could be a little better
Reviews.Author: dd
Reviews.Content: This a nice camera, however I think the Touch screen does not work like it should. It doesn't sense the the touch of finger as well as it should although the camer does take good pictures and the touch screen settings takes a little while to get used to.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk. Shame on Nikon.
Reviews.Author: W. J. Maselunas
Reviews.Content: This camera was inexpensive, so we went for it.  I've used Nikon SLR's and loved them, and so trusted the Nikon name.  Bad move. The S4100 is plasticky and feels cheap, but I was OK with that at this price point.  However, after less than a month of use and maybe two battery charges, it's dead.  We get the "Battery Exhausted" message and it will no longer charge.  A quick check of the Nikon discussion boards reveals that this problem is rampant and Nikon, apparently, has yet to do anything to make it right.Two words: "Hello, Canon!"

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: AshMet
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting a couple of years to purchase a new digital camera and this one has been the perfect fit for me so far. Outdoor photos turn out very beautifully. I have not used very much indoors but when I have, they turn out well and I have no complaints. The camera came already fully charged. I have used it quite a bit and with flash. The battery is still going strong and I have yet to charge it. I am looking forward to using the camera more often.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: J. Robbins
Reviews.Content: the other reviews on here say stuff about problems with the touch screen/pictures in general. and so when i got this camera i was hoping it would rise above their standards, and it did. this is a great camera for its price and takes amazing pictures. i was very surprised & very pleased. i would recommend this camera for anyone!

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed!!
Reviews.Author: jess1979
Reviews.Content: I received the camera and used it one time and the battery died pretty quick when I went to charge it, it would not charge at all. I am very disappointed because it was bought to take on a family vacation but instead I ended up sending it back the day that we left.

Reviews.Title: Wish I hadn't bought it!
Reviews.Author: Debbie L. Hamilton "DH"
Reviews.Content: After just a few weeks, I could no longer charge the camera.  Then INikon COOLPIX S4100 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch Touch-Panel LCD (Red) read the reviews and found that this is common.  Now i have to see if Nikon will fix it.  Definitely not worth buying since it is very likely not to last more than a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for a beginner
Reviews.Author: Frenchie
Reviews.Content: My mom isn't very good with cameras and wanted one that was simple to use. The touch screen is handy, and she loves that is has so many photo settings so she can just pick the right one rather than adjusting everything herself. She's very happy with it, and the photo editing program that it came with is easy to use and works well too.

Reviews.Title: do NOT buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: K. White
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last summer only to find that the battery will not charge. I sent the camera back, purchased the exact same product and now this one has the same defect. I was sold on this camera because I know people who have the previous version and they love it! I would not buy this camera again and now am stuck with a camera that doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: TOTAL COMPLETE CRAP  DO NOT BUY CUSTOMER SUPPORT (NIKON) is USELESS
Reviews.Author: yawn
Reviews.Content: I got this as a present and didn't buy it thu Amazon BUT... I had not used it since Christmas day until a few days ago I decided to "play" with it and look and see what the reviews are online.  I found time after time they are having charging issues and they are so packed with options for each and every location your shooting at you go thru hell to get the setting just right to get good pictures. You press the button to take a picture and sometimes a picture is taken other times you can press that button til the battery is dead and STILL no picture gets taken.  My old trusty Cannon is 10 years old 1/3 the mega pixels blows the doors off this 14 mega pixels pile of dog poop. Since I got it as a Christmas present I wanted to return it since I read about all the issues. Cannon says no Wal Mart says no. So here I sit feeling cheated and used like a doormat.  YEA yea sure it may just be a few bad s4100's out there, but from what I am seeing it looks to me EVERY one of these are crapping out.. So I view it as getting into a car that has serious reliability issues on a long trip meaning I'm pretty sure if I REALLY needed to take a picture this camera is likely to die just when you need it the most.  My OLD cannon is now 10 years old and I have never even had it fail me in ANYWAY even ONCE.  I decided since my old camera is just so much better than most new cameras I bought 3 used and or refurbished ones.  I not a penny wise pound foolish shopper and IF I was looking for a current model digital camera shopper I would have never bought this model and now that I was "slapped in the face" by Nikon when and if I do look for a new Camera NIKON is not getting my money.  Walmart gets my money ONLY for common household "staple" stuff. ARRRRRGGHHH!!!!

Reviews.Title: Bad!! Don't Buy This Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Andy McNutt "Andy McNutt"
Reviews.Content: No stars!  Spare yourself the frustration!  Don't buy this camera!  The touch screen interface is bad.  tap-tap-tap, no response.  Oh I'll respond and take you to a sub-menu you didn't intend.  The buttons on my 3 year old camera were slow, but this one is stunningly slow.  The video button takes about 5 seconds to respond.  The macro doesn't auto-focus worth anything.  Sometimes a normal shot won't auto-focus.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera despite negative reviews
Reviews.Author: mommy of two
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. I had reservations about it after I read the reviews on it. Especially with the battery issues. After I got the camera I found that when charging the battery it should be plugged into the wall outlet last. Then when disconnecting the camera from the battery charger it should be unplugged from the wall first. Otherwise it will cause issues with the battery. It clearly states this in the instruction manual. It is very easy to use and is compact which is nice because as a mother of two small children ease of use is very important. The flash does take a few seconds to recharge and when the battery is getting low the pictures start to get blurry. I have purchased two extra battery packs just to have on hand. They are very inexpensive on ebay and amazon. Another issue I read about was the touch screen. The camera comes with a stylus that can be attached to the strap and I haven't had any problems with it. There are many different settings on the camera that I am still getting used to and trying out. Very nice camera. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Terrible Terrible!!!! 0 STARS
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I am an avid picture taker and have had all Sony Digital cameras  and loved them! But I needed a new one decided I would try the this one. BIG Mistake!!!! I am totally unhappy with it after less than a week and I am returning it tomorrow. The camera is slow and I am missing good shots! And then when I do get a shot its blurry! its suppose to be a point and shot but yet it my pics are fuzzy.. go figure! I am going back to my Sony's! Save your money and dont buy this camera!!!!

Reviews.Title: Charger quit working in less than a month!
Reviews.Author: W. Cronk
Reviews.Content: The Charger quit working in less than a month, and they wanted me to pay to ship the entire product back to service it.  The Adapter would cost less than the shipping to replace!  The customer service was really rude!  I have now read a lot of reviews that show the same problem, the adapter just quits working.  Dont buy!

Reviews.Title: Not Sure about this Nikon
Reviews.Author: Peter Archangeli
Reviews.Content: Have a Nikon DSLR that takes amazing photos with a complete dummy (me) operating it.  Therefore, when I decided to upgrade my point and shoot, I had a strong preference for Nikon even though I've had a good experience with Sony products.Long story short, after less then a week, the LCD display broke...which, unfortunately, seems to be a relatively common complaint on Nikon point and shoots based on reviews.During the time that I used it, I would say that - as expected - some of the photos were amazing. However, even when not needing the flash it took a long time for the shutter to activate, and I found it slow between shots...so I felt like I was "losing" some good shots of my son.  To me, the whole point of these cameras is to be easy and idiot proof.  Not sure I can say that about this one.

Reviews.Title: Great little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Gaea
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little point and shoot camera.  In addition to this little pocket cam, I also have a Cannon Rebel XTi.  As that camera is too big to carry around all the time, I often use this camera for friends' birthday parties, quick hikes, etc.  I have been surprised at the quality of photos this camera produces.  Occassionally, they are even better than the Rebel photos.  The touch screen is a great feature, and I like being able to scroll with the screen.  The memory card holds A TON of pictures.  I can go months without deleting.  The size is super convenient and fits in my pocket.  A few issues:  1 - You have to use your fingernail to scroll when using the touchscreen, it doesn't like finger tips.  Not sure that it would be of much use to someone with very short nails. 2 - I have not been able to figure out how to format the memory card from the camera.  I load all the photos to my computer, then delete the camera pics while I'm in the folder (on the comp).  3 - You have to charge using your computer or a USB port to wall converter.  There is no removable battery pack to charge (biggest drawback).  Overall, the value for the money can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: Battery Freeze-Up
Reviews.Author: DG
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a year.  I would NOT buy it again because of the following - but I think I have good news for others:Problem 1:  very slow picture taking - I'd have to wait up to 10 seconds in between pictures if I wanted to take 2 in a row -frustrating!  I researched and found it might be because of the memory card - be sure you use an approved card for use with this camera type - the more pics I had on the card, the slower the camera functioned.Problem 2: camera froze with shutter open, screen turned green, and the battery was not accepting any charge when I plugged in the charger to the wall- I thought the camera was totally dead.  I brought it to a specialty camera store - they said I needed a new camera.HOWEVER, here's the good news for you all with this similar problem:  I took it to Batteries Plus store and they said it was a BATTERY problem, not a camera problem.  They said that the lithium batteries automatically shut OFF if the battery has less than half charge and is not used for more than a month!  They charged the battery for us and the camera is now working again!

Reviews.Title: PATHETIC and I'm not the only one
Reviews.Author: Zac H
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift last Christmas, didn't even last a year. The lens won't open, the battery wouldn't charge.How sad.  I have an Olympus C-3000 that's probably 12 to 15 years old.... still workingI have a Canon 20-D that's 7 years old......still workingI have a Nikon FE2 that's nearly 25 years old......still workingShame on you Nikon for selling us this faulted product, I'm not the only one, I've seen tons of other reviewsAmazon, please drop this product for the sake of the unsuspecting publicDO NOT PURCHASE !!!!!

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S4100 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch Touch-Panel LCD (Black)
Reviews.Author: John Tipler Sr.
Reviews.Content: The Nikon COOLPIX S4100 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch Touch-Panel LCD (Black),that I recently purchased is exactly the camera I was looking for. Is is compact, easy to use, and of very good quality.

Reviews.Title: Battery Problems
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: After a couple of weeks of using camera, and no more than 50 pictures, the battery would stop accepting a charge.  Camera took nice pictures, but without battery doesn't matter.  DON'T BUY!

Reviews.Title: For Shame, Nikon!
Reviews.Author: Bookish
Reviews.Content: I've always been a fan of Nikon and currently own the D90, which I love! However, I don't always want to carry a large camera with me, so I picked up the Coolpix S4100 because I can carry it around in my purse.  Little did I realize what a piece of junk Nikon was willing to put out in the marketplace.  What were they thinking?  The photos are mostly awful, and regularly blurry. If I get a good shot I consider it a stroke of luck.  Now I can't get the battery to charge, which is probably a good thing because I keep trying to make it "work".  It's been a exercise in futility.  Don't waste your money.  Truly disappointed. :-(

Reviews.Title: I had big expectations but I'm still trying to find a secret to the camera to not be so disapointed.
Reviews.Author: valeria
Reviews.Content: I read all reviews and decided to go for this camera. I charged the camera before I turned it on for the first time and started shooting pictures of everything in my sight. I was excited until the first 10 minutes of me trying the camera, the lens got stuck going back in and the screen turned green until it shut off completely and I got the lens to go in all the way. Another day and the same things happen. So halloween comes and I take my kid trick or treating and the pictures come out like it was raining chocolate outside, bad pictures. I had it on automatic. Its slow to take the pictures and you have to wait for the caremra to be ready before the nect picture.

Reviews.Title: Not worth buying
Reviews.Author: Dan in VA
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera becuase I thought it was pretty good based on the reviews, but after testing it out when we got it and playing with the touch screen we had terrible luck with it.  On the third use the touch screen/camera view screen when all white.  You can find others online that had the same problem.  No way to fix it or to review the pictures you took or see what picture you're currently taking when this happens.  The camera still worked since we could see the pictures on the computer but you're basically shooting pictures blind which is not what you want.  I've had probably 10 different digital cameras over the years between my wife and family and I've never had one with this quick of a problem before.  Bad luck?  Maybe, but I'll stick to sony instead of giving Nikon a shot 'pun intended'.

Reviews.Title: Design flaws make this camera clumsy to use
Reviews.Author: Old Drums
Reviews.Content: (Revised 12/21/11) I have owned and used the S4100 for a few months now, and use it every day for work. In a nutshell, I don't recommend it for the following reasons:1. Despite a large, easy to use shutter release button on the top of the camera, an inadvertent touch of the touch-screen takes an unintentional photo. Why, Nikon, why?(Found out that through a menu command this "feature" can be disabled. It is not very straighforward - one must choose the function for the touchscreen to do something different, "Touch AE/AF" or "Subject Tracking".)2. When at the max optical zoom, the shutter release nearly always causes camera movement resulting in blurred photo. (This was also corrected by enabling the electronic vibration reduction - which defaults to off.)3. The touchscreen is not responsive at times. Pushing repeatedly at the on-screen menus sometimes only takes a picture rather than bringing up the menu. (No fix for this that I have found. Very frustrating trying to open and navigate menus.)4. I have not used a lot of video, but I have read and experienced that keeping a moving subject in focus is almost impossible. Do not purchase this camera if your primary use will be videotaping action.Other than those quirks, the quality of the photos (clarity, color, exposure) can be outstanding if you know what you're doing. Overall, slightly more complicated than a point and shoot camera should be out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Arianaaa
Reviews.Content: I have a digital photography class and my old camera was still running on batteries, I didn't want to spend 500 dollars on a professional camera since this was only an elective for me and my professor said any point and shoot will do for the class so I purchased the Nikon Cool Pix and I love it! Its super portable, very good quality pictures and nice looking. Has many functions for all types of pictures you would like to take. Love it!

Reviews.Title: PIECE OF JUNK
Reviews.Author: Alejo Aguirre "Alex"
Reviews.Content: If you want a decent pocketable camera go with a canon s90 or s95. The S4100 is just crap. Image quality sucks and the camera will stop working within the next 2 or 3 moths after the purchase.  Do not waste your money on this.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Marian Thai
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed when I got the camera. It is VERY SLOW in taking pics, I didnt like the touch screen, and the battery compartment was a little loose. I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: mhall
Reviews.Content: I did not like this camera. The touch screen didn't work that well. Had to touch an item many times to get it to work. Did not take good pics in low light. The speed of the shutter slowed when there wasn't enough light causing blurry pics. And the main thing I didn't like was that I couldn't change the white balance on scene options (example - on the landscape mode I couldn't change the white balance to sunny, shady, cloudy)

Reviews.Title: Only had the camera 4 months and it has quit working
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: Easter morning going to take pictures of the grandbaby with his basket and the camera won't charge...very disappointed. Buyer Beware

Reviews.Title: Camera Won't Charge
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Copelin
Reviews.Content: A few months after purchase, this camera wouldn't charge despite the fact that the green light was blinking.  Since it was under warranty, I had it repaired.  A few months later I had the same problem again.  Now the warranty has expired, so I have a paperweight.  I would bet that all the positive comments about this camera were written immediately after purchase.

Reviews.Title: Save your money, DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Rooskie
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying I have had this camera for 11 months. Nikon has about the worst customer service I have experienced when it comes to repairs. I received this camera last year for Christmas from my husband, so I have receipts and documentation and all that jazz. Upon opening the camera, it's pretty awesome at first use. Easy usability, some great features for an inexpensive camera. But, just use it for a couple weeks and you'll have problems. Zoom button quits working, lens cover won't open without assist of my fingers prying it open (therefore creating smudges on the lens), blurry spots on the screen, etc.So, camera sent in, was "fixed" and sent back to me. Zoom button works slightly, but not sensitive enough to even take a zoomed picture within any reasonable length of time it takes to get the zoom toggle to actually move. The lens cover still was sticking, although not as consistently as before. Ultimately sent the camera in again, with the exact same problems as it was having within weeks out of the box. Now, they say it is my fault, that the camera has water damage. HELLO! The lens cover was not closing! No kidding there's water damage. But, the kicker is they wanted me to pay a repair charge of $110.00. I don't think so! You can buy this P.O.S. on Amazon for $99.00 right now, I'm sure you could even find better deals being that its the holidays.SAVE YOUR MONEY AND DO NOT BUY A NIKON! I have owned many cameras in my life, and I will revert back to brands that stand by their customers and their warranties. Not a company that you get a run around from every employee who tries to get out of their crappy manufacturing flaws. Read other reviews and you will run far far away from the Nikon CoolPix camera!

Reviews.Title: Not happy
Reviews.Author: Real Fakename
Reviews.Content: Okay I know this is a low end camera and i had low expectations but i was still dissappointed.1) image are shaky even in daylight. I have even asked my friends to try it out the they get shaky images too sometimes2) at night time... i didnt expect it to click good pictures and it didnt3) i have to use the touch screen  it take out good pictures in daylight. (if i use button to click the image gets shaky)So please dont but this camera if you want low light pics to be even resonably good.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Rick Andrade
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera ever. I have not been able to charge the battery after it died. I bought one for my wife last year at Christmas. She keeps it in her purse and uses it a few time a month. Because I bought it a month or so before Christmas and by the time the battery needed charging, it was past the 90 day warranty. The camera just will not charge. Reading the reviews here and on Nikon's website, this seems to be a major problem with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera!
Reviews.Author: Enelyak
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd camera I've had like this in the past year! I purchased the S4000 last year and while on a trip I dropped it, dented it around the lens and it read lens error. Yeah, I understand that was my fault for the camera not working. This camera was inexpensive and I thought it took good pictures for the price, so I decided to try again and buy the newer model of the camera that I had. I bought this camera last November and have only used it a few times since then. I never dropped it, or got it wet (I always stored it in a case.)This weekend I went on a trip so obviously, I was using the camera a lot. After taking maybe 150 or more pictures, I turned the camera on and all a sudden the screen said lens error. I turned it off then back on again and the screen was all blurry and it wouldn't turn off right away when I pressed the on/off button - The screen was green too. I turned it back on again and the lens comes out, but then 2 seconds later the camera shuts off by itself! after I used the camera I'd turn it off so I wouldn't waste battery power, and would turn it on again when I wanted to take a picture. I don't see why turning it off and on would ruin the lens, but if so, what a peice of crap this camera is. I don't understand why all a sudden I got a lens error. This camera is shot now, and after buying 2 cameras, and having them break within a year, I will never buy a Nikon again. Save your money and buy a different brand of camera that's going to last!!!

Reviews.Title: lens has broken a second time
Reviews.Author: E. Bradford
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Coolpix S4100 last year before a trip in August, worked fine at first, great quality photos and easy to use.  Ended up shipping it back in 4 mos as the lens  would not open, and then exhausted the battery. That was in November.  Now it has happened a second time, and as it is 13 months old, they want $99 to fix it.  I don't think I'll pay for this as a new one is only a little more.  We always kept the camera in a little case, it is clean and cared for, I don't think we are that hard on the product.I do like Nikon and have an SLR as well, but I like having a pocket sized one for our outings when we don't want to lug the big one around.  I'm disappointed and wondering if others have suggestions on a different pocket sized point and shoot from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Shoulda listened to the reviews
Reviews.Author: Brainfreeze
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera from amazon in late April; the battery died while on vacation at the beginning of August and will NOT re-charge.  I should've listened to all the reviews here that warned about this problem.  The camera was a great deal-fabulous price for the options-so I didn't listen.  Because of that, I was left with a dead camera for the last month of summer vacation.  I feel sick at having spent the money and now have nothing.Update and downgrade to my rating:  I followed the online directions for returning the dead camera with battery, to the letter.  Filled out online form, wrapped up the camera SEPARATELY from the tiny battery (how dumb is it that they tell you to take the tiny battery OUT of the camera for shipment?) and paid to send it to them.  They sent a friendly status update that my camera was still under warranty so no cost to "fix" it but......then sent back my camera with an invoice stating that my camera was fine.  They said there was no battery included, which was WRONG.  They must've thrown it away when they unpacked it because it sure as heck WAS included. So now I'm out an additional $10 and I still have a dead camera that only worked for four months.  *B* *S*Ongoing drama....so I called customer service to complain that, even though I sent paperwork stating that I was including the camera and battery, and included the camera and battery...they returned the camera stating they did not receive a battery.  Customer service said they'd talk to service dept and get back to me.  <crickets> <crickets> Seven days later and no word, so I called back.  The new CS girl said that the service dept never emailed the first CS back, which is why the first CS didn't get back in touch with me.  New CS girl said she'd re-email service dept and see if they'll respond this time.  Er.....is this the best they can do?  Really?  What a set-up: talk to CS, service dept simply ignores CS, no resolution EVER.  CS said that's all she can do because they can't call service dept, only email.  Consumer is screwed.

Reviews.Title: dont buy
Reviews.Author: Stephanie L. Krueger
Reviews.Content: i wish i could give this a neg.star. it would not charge even after buy a new charger and trying to hook it up to my computer.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!  STOPPED CHARGING within 5 months.  AWFUL!
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: WORST camera ever purchased.  I bought this camera in February of 2012....was broken by June 2012.I barely even used the camera.  I remember having a 1980s disc camera and it worked for like 10 years!!!Then I go to Costco to try to exchange it but, of course, they already phased out this model and you can't exchange or return it.I really think they must update the models each 90 days on purpose....so that you can't exchange/return once it breaks after 90 days.Nikon should be ashamed!!  Will not buy a Nikon product again.  DO NOT BUY!!

Reviews.Title: Battery won't charge
Reviews.Author: D. Burton
Reviews.Content: After 7 photos (it can take beautiful photos) and one 9 second video (also looks great) the battery won't take a charge. Wish I'd read the reviews before I bought this camera for my dad to document stage 4 pancreatic cancer.  This camera seems to destroy batteries and all Nikon says about it is to buy a new battery, and don't charge it for more than two hours, or it will be "exhausted" (that the last word the camera communicates to you with it's last bit of juice, then it's just dead.

Reviews.Title: Avoid! Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Q. Yuan
Reviews.Content: As with everybody else who purchased this camera, the battery won't charge after about a month's use. Worst camera ever! You as a consumer has to pay to ship it to Nikon to have it repaired. Sucks! Worst, I bought one as a gift to someone who is now out of country. Wow, it is not even covered under the warranty, even it is within the first year. So overall, avoid it. There are so many much better cameras out there for this price range.My Nikon service order # is 5861053. Just got the camera back, but I have no confidence in Nikon. Will get my money back using Maryland Lemon law. Check your state's lemon law to protect yourself.

Reviews.Title: NIKON S4100:  touch screen???
Reviews.Author: larryb
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews, bought it anyway  for my non-techee wife thinking that surely Nikon has fixed the problems  mentioned in the many posts here.  I don't know about the battery issue 'cause I returned it too soon to find out.  The touch screen is terrible, slow, unresponsive and totally non-intuitive.  I gave it the 1 star because the pic quality (non telo) is quite good.  That's it!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: tule_elk6x6
Reviews.Content: So far I have been really impressed with this little camera. It is easy to use with the large touchscreen. To my eye, seems to take nice clear pictures. Good zoom range. I'm not a pro, and for a duffer like me, it's perfect for my snapshots. For the price, I don't think you can beat it for a compact point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Worst Services and Camera
Reviews.Author: nv
Reviews.Content: This camera did not meet my expectations. It takes horrible pictures. Nikon's services are horrible as well. They did not want to fix any damages despite the fact that I had warranty on it. Never buy the warranty-it's a waste of money.Apart from bad customer service, the images are just plain bad. The quality isn't that great. The touch screen feature only makes it seem cool but in reality any other simple camera can take a better picture.

Reviews.Title: I want my Canon back
Reviews.Author: Malea Bastian "MMBastian"
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to get this new camera, in a pretty plum color, with lots of great features.  My Canon was over 4 years old and had been dropped many times and was starting to break down.  After only 2 months, my son dropped this Nikon- from a height of only 1 foot- and now the lens won't open or close, but stays stuck in one position. We must send it off for repairs that, from all research we have done, will probably cost at least $100.  Hardly worth it, since I only paid that much for it (I bought it on sale).  I'm upset that it couldn't handle such a short fall, especially since our Canon went through so many drops from far greater heights and still worked like a pro.  While we wait to decide what to do with this Nikon, we're back to using our Canon.  Because it still works.  Which is more than I can say for this Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: Mr. E
Reviews.Content: The camera I received charges just fine, that was my only concern for this camera.  I went to local stores Radio Shack, Target and Office Max to look for cameras, they all had the S4100 on display, but were sold out after their sales at $99.  I figured I would wait to get it shipped and pay no sales tax on Amazon it was also $10 less before tax on Amazon, so I ended up paying $18.91 less when ordering online, so thanks Amazon for saving me 17.5%.  It takes great pictures with little lag time between photos and has a pretty good video camera as well.  It's the best camera I have ever owned, (not saying much I usually opt for the cheapest one since I have a tendency to lose or break them) better than what I need, but much cheaper than many inferior cameras at $89.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy unless you like paying a monthly fee for use.
Reviews.Author: C. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Just like so many other reviews on this camera, I too have/am experiencing the no charging issue.  This perhaps the worst digital camera I have ever used in my entire life.  If the batteries stop charging after one month, then why not make it able to use AA instead of expensive battery packs?My son got this camera from his grandmother for Christmas and right out of the box it would not charge the battery.  Instead of calling Nikon's WONDERFUL customer service only for them to tell me batteries aren't covered under warranty, I decided to buy another battery pack from my local B&M; store and the camera started to work again.  The picture quality was good enough my for my son and he had no complaints.  However just over a month of usage, the new battery will not charge anymore either, so the 15 bucks I spent on the battery pack for this camera is now gone.The only way to get it working again is to buy ANOTHER battery pack, and a month later ANOTHER battery pack, in other words in order to use this camera, you effectively have to pay a monthly fee since you have to replace the battery so often.This camera is useless, and Nikon is a terrible company for selling such a piece of junk.  Avoid this camera like the plague and while you are at it, avoid Nikon as well, any company that will knowingly sell a camera that can't even charge is a shady company that does not deserve your business.I would give this camera 0 stars if I could.

Reviews.Title: What a piece of junk!
Reviews.Author: Cristin
Reviews.Content: This camera is a nightmare!  I purchased it at Costco before a trip to Thailand.  Only had it about a week when something went horrible wrong.  The battery died and refused to recharge!  On top of that all of the pictures on the memory card were deleted!!!  We were able to salvage a few of the photos with a recovery software.  Others are forever corrupt and lost.  My recommendation - DO  NOT purchase this camera!

Reviews.Title: Average camera
Reviews.Author: ausmos
Reviews.Content: This is an average camera. It is no better or worse than any of the cameras we have previously owned. My biggest problem with it is that there isn't really a good setting for photographing kids, who tend to move a lot and require a faster shutter. The touchscreen is nice in that it allows the display to be bigger than most other cameras, but it makes changing settings take longer than cameras that dont have the touch screen. Overall, it is a decent camera, but I would not buy it again if I had it to do over.

Reviews.Title: great camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: Joanne M. Roberts
Reviews.Content: am very happy with my purchase....camera price was much better than I could get locally and it arrived quickly and was well packed...very satisfied

Reviews.Title: Loved it from the first time a held it in my hands. Easy to use and upload to computer.
Reviews.Author: g8twh
Reviews.Content: Its a great product straight out of the box. Its easy to use and that quality of picture is amazing. Only issue I have and this is a personal issue. The on/off button and shutter button are a bit to close. Missed a few pics cuz I hit the wrong button.Service was great even when the battery died one week after purchase. Battery was replaced without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: great replacement
Reviews.Author: Herman Schueneman
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for an older Coolpix and is two hundred percent better. It takes better pictures and vidios, sharper closeups, just a better all around camera.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: M. Santos
Reviews.Content: It's a good camera for who wants a basic one. It's beautiful, thin, light weight.Great negotiaton, it came on the time I expected with the memory card I bought together.

Reviews.Title: Gift for Teen
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: We purchases this camera as a gift for our 14 year old.  She has had no problem using it with no assistance from anyone.

Reviews.Title: Blurry pictures and problems with cards and battery
Reviews.Author: Blue
Reviews.Content: I absolutely agree with some other customers reviews. I had the same problems. The camera itself looks great and the touch screen is really convenient but it has several issues with the battery and images are often blurry.Yesterday, I bought a high speed SDHC card that is supposed to be compatible with this camera and sometimes it works and sometimes the camera can't read the card. Certainly, I didn't expect all these issues in a Nikon product. I wouldn't buy it again and neither recommend it.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: bre2013
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with the product I recieved. The battery compartment door is a little off but the camera works great. I really needed a new camera and I was happy to find this one. I really love that it is my favorite color and it came in the box with all the accessories. Thank you soooo very much.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Ms. "J"
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use and handles very well. I like that it's small enough to store in a small hand bag. Great cmera!Nikon COOLPIX S3100 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 2.7-Inch LCD (Purple)

Reviews.Title: Useless. But cute.
Reviews.Author: Marilyn Armstrong
Reviews.Content: I own expensive cameras and I have, over the years, owned many point and shoot cameras because there are times when I don't want to bring the more expensive, bigger cameras. Most of my point and shoot cameras were from Canon. The picture quality on these ran from very good to excellent. Even the least expensive ones took good quality pictures.This camera takes fuzzy pictures. The auto focus is very slow and inaccurate, especially close up (I don't mean "macro" close ... I mean a few feet). The only thing it shoots with any degree of sharpness are landscapes, but even an old Brownie camera with no focus mechanism could do that. I'm glad I didn't pay much for it. In my opinion this barely qualifies as a camera. My telephone takes pictures that are as sharp or sharper than this camera. The reason I don't use my telephone to take pictures is I don't like taking pictures on a non-camera.I have tested this camera now in a range of conditions, with and without flash.It isn't bad with flash, but recycling time is very slow. You have to wait 5 to 10 seconds between shots on a full battery. If you are trying to catch "action" at, say, a kid's party, use a better camera. This won't do the job.It does NOT come with a separate battery charger. You have to charge the battery IN the camera or buy an after-market external charger. I bought an external one for about $5 and a couple of spare batteries for $4.58. Don't pay more. It isn't worth it.What's good about it? It's small, light and cute. Also, I got it cheap. Its list price is $179 and I hope nobody really pays that. There's a new version (S4300)out, but the specs are essentially the same, so don't expect it to be better.If you are looking for a small, light camera to take with you when you don't want to bring your bigger, much more expensive gear, this is not the camera for you. Get any one of the Canon point and shoots. Even the worst one beats this by a country mile.If you are s snap shooter who can't tell if the picture is fuzzy or not and really doesn't care anyhow, and if you get the camera as a gift, it might be better than nothing. Free is the right price point for this charming, attractive piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Stopped charging
Reviews.Author: Michaud Kindle Users
Reviews.Content: I have the same problem others have had in the fact the camera stopped charging after having it for 6 months.  It is under warranty, but, need to ship it to the Nikon service dealer to be looked at to determine if it is covered.  This is obviously a known problem w/these cameras, but when talking w/Nikon they tell me they aren't aware of any problems with these camers not charging.  I will NEVER by a Nikon camera again.

Reviews.Title: uSER MANUAL
Reviews.Author: CBC5170
Reviews.Content: I have always had a Canon and truly loved it and the fact that it provided a user Manual.  My Canon still works great, but is 10 years old, and I wanted to get a new camera.  I heard about the Coolpix Nikon and thought I'd try it.  After trying to read the online user manual, I called Nikon to find out how to purchase a paper manual and was told that they do not provide one,  You have to use the CD User Manual which is a real pain cause it doesn't download to your computer therefore everytime you have a question or want to find out how to do something, you need to insert the CD and then read about it, if you can find the answer.  This is a BIG inconvenience as I like to carry my user manual with me when I travel in case I have a problem, I would look in the manual to find out how to fix it.  You can print the User Manual from the CD --- it is 208 pages.  Do you realize how much ink you'll use and time!  This is a major disappointment.  So I can't comment on the Camera since I have to read the manual, whenver I get it printed.  I'm using my Canon cause I know how to use it and I have a manual for reference.  Also, the touch screen monitor does not work with using your finger,  You have to use the Stylus to move the screen.  Another disappointment.  I wish I would have saved my money.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful little camera!
Reviews.Author: Christi <3
Reviews.Content: I've had 3 other point & shoots; a Fugifilm, Canon and Vivitar, and this is by far the best. It is an amazing price for a whopping 14 MPs and touchscreen!Pros:> Image quality is spectacular. The picture shows beautiful details from miles away.> Colors are vivid and true to life!> Touchscreen aids in the ease of use. I love being able to flick around my pictures, and to adjust the settings without opening menus.> Attractive camera! I've received many compliments on the plum color, and it's small enough to fit in my pocket.> Huge panel, lots of room for handy touch controls and displaying pictures.> There are many scenes to pick from, ranging from night portrait to food.Cons:> Very slow playback. It takes 5 seconds for the shot to be reviewed.> Focus...can take a couple tries to get a picture perfectly focused.> Charging difficulties. Once, it randomly would not charge, then randomly started to accept it. Weird?> Occasionaly finicky touchscreen. You have to apply the pefect amount of pressue to scroll/click.Overall, I recommend this nifty Nikon. I have been using it all summer, and I love almost every picture it has taken. Once you take time to read the manual and get accustomed to the controls, you will find it extremely easy to use and packed with cool features like sorting-by-favorites and touch subject tracking .Enjoy, and hope this helped! (:

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: XxPxX
Reviews.Content: I bought this in need of a new camera and finally had the chance of getting a Nikon. I've loved it since the day I bought it. I've had no problems whatsoever with it, so other reviewers must be handling it too roughly XD. Close-up mode, you really need a steady hand for otherwise pictures will turn out blurry. Other than that, pictures are outstanding and filled with clarity.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Kris the math teacher "Kris"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon CoolPix is a great little camera. I got one about 4 months ago, and loved it so much that we got this one for my husband. It is easy to use, easy to download, and the small size fits in your purse or pocket easily. I also love the charger, which works from a plug or USB. I don't know how they did the surface, but it feels soft to the touch. If you want to experiment, the "scenes" are fun, but mostly I use it on auto mode.

Reviews.Title: Good, sturdy Camera
Reviews.Author: kzyin
Reviews.Content: I like how the camera feels, nice and small. It captures good quality photos. However, the touchscreen can be a little hard to use at first, but you'll learn fast.Video quality is decent, and so far I've only taken videos at night and obviously there's a lot of noise(grains) when I watched the videos again. I have yet to try taking videos during the day.

Reviews.Title: 2 broken cameras!!!
Reviews.Author: Gregg Mitchell "zgregm"
Reviews.Content: Ok... So i got this camera and i thought that the pictures were really nice and there were a ton of cool editing options but then when i was on vacation it wouldn't charge so we returned it then i ordered another one and it woudn't charge either!!!!! I love the camera but i hate the fact it wont charge. Its in the store getting fixed now

Reviews.Title: Pretty good pocket camera
Reviews.Author: tom
Reviews.Content: bought this camera last week and took it to a 3-day music festival over the weekend. the touch screen is very responsive and easy to use for the most part. the best feature about this camera (to me) is how fast it turns on. very quickly goes from being off to taking a picture. i was worried about the picture quality when looking at the pics on the camera itself, but once i transferred and viewed them on my computer, they looked great with the exception of a few taken at night, in which you could see a lot of static in the background. all in all, i'm happy with the purchase

Reviews.Title: Battery/Charger problems with this camera
Reviews.Author: RM2011 "Rob"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera the day before our vacation and half way through our vacation, I went to charge it and it would not charge. Connected the camera to a laptop via the supplied cable and would not connect. So no camera for the rest of our vacation! After reading all the comments posted it sounds like a battery issue. For the time the camera worked, it did take some great shots.....but we are returning it and will buy a Cannon instead. Watch out!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S4100 - Problems with charger
Reviews.Author: Tracey A. Johnston "Aldendale"
Reviews.Content: My daughter gave me this camera for my birthday.  It was great at first, but, when I needed to recharge it, the usb cable that plugs into the outlet charger no longer works after only 2 months!  Contacted Nikon almost 2 weeks ago and they still haven't given me an answer.  Also, the USB cable that came with my daughter's high end camera from Nikon ALSO stopped working after only 6 months.  Seems to me that Nikon has a problem with their cables.  Never had these kind of problems with my Olympus or Kodak digital cameras.  The Kodak is over 5 years old and since I can't recharge the battery on my Nikon, I've been using that one.  I do really like the touch screen on the Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: beauty in a box
Reviews.Content: the camera was compact and has HD movie/video haven't learned to make it last longer if possible that would be the only down side other than that it was every thing i was looking for in a compact camera.

Reviews.Title: NIkon Cool Pix S4100 review
Reviews.Author: Stephen Birdsall
Reviews.Content: Wow, fast shipping, great camera with easy to use features, and simple to use touch screen.  Pictures have great color saturation and definition.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy!
Reviews.Author: Peter J McMahon Jr
Reviews.Content: I've had the same issues as most of the other people with negative comments, This Camera never even charged the first time after the initial use, I bought this camera as a small easy to use camera when I didn't want to drag the Nikon D3100 around for just a few pictures on a short trip.. Unfortunately I bought the camera in Feb  took a few pictures, was well satisfied, then the wife took it on vacation in July, and it never charged..After reading the comments from others who have had the same problem I can't believe a company like Nikon would not recall this camera and either replace it or substitute a different model.. Live and Learn People the short and (Bittersweet)is this camera Sucks!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: elstein
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after quite a consumer review search.  It is great, easy to use, and small enough to stash anywhere. Did I mention how easy it is to download photos!  Great service from shipper.  Just love it.

Reviews.Title: If you like to shoot people this one is for you.
Reviews.Author: J. Richards
Reviews.Content: I am more than pleased with this Camera. Right out of the box it takes your image and amps them up. You really can't go wrong when using this little camera. I bought this Camera for my wife. She loves to take pictures of Everything. From the time that she opened the box until now she hasn't put it down as yet. I am very impressed with picture quality if I had only one word to describe them then I would use the word Amazing. Its so small and practical and fits in the palm of her hand. I can guarantee that if you are looking for a fun gift this is the way to go. You will not be disappointed if you have someone in the family that likes to capture every moment you will be doing them a great favor and earn cool points at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Click off this camera!
Reviews.Author: EarlyAdoptee
Reviews.Content: Telescoping mechanism began to click within a week (less than 100 shots)and began to freeze only a short while longer.  Too much hassle for the money, even if the camera is otherwise a lot of fun and has so much versatility - it could also use a close-up setting that minimizes flash - causes white wash on faces that isn't that easy to correct in editing (no amount of scotch tape seems to dim that bright white flash).

Reviews.Title: Love at first shot!
Reviews.Author: D. Smith "Ms.Shon"
Reviews.Content: Beautiful color. Easily to use. I have long nails and can use the touch screen with no problems. Vivid colors.

Reviews.Title: Crap
Reviews.Author: M. Deluco "MaD"
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for a month.I find it very difficult to get a shot that isnt blurry. Then the lens stopped opening. it says it is fully charged but it also says "lens error".And another guy im working with has the same camera and also says it sucks....

Reviews.Title: Really wanted to like this camera, but....
Reviews.Author: marson
Reviews.Content: like one of the other reviewers, the shutter broke on the second day.  It took great pictures and videos when it was working so I was really sad that I had to return it right away.  I did notice that it was hard to screen through the pictures with the touch screen.  I would buy this camera again if Nikon made it more durable because of the picture and video quality, and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Passed owner, one dislike
Reviews.Author: Memere Gene
Reviews.Content: I have had two previous Nikon COOLPIX cameras and enjoyed the ease of taking pictures.  The timing between picture taken is too slow with this camera, unless there is an adjustment I don't know about which is why I gave it a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: lcd screen stopped suddenly.  does not work any longer
Reviews.Author: P. Steinkamp "peat"
Reviews.Content: loved it for a few months.  took a picture, put it in jacket pocket, took camera out to take another picture, and lcd screen no longer worked.  Called Nikon and was told it sounded like it was bumped.  If bumped, warranty no good.  Hmmm.  got bumped whilst in my jacket pocket.  thought I should post a review how fragile these are.  enjoy, but be careful with them.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: elida
Reviews.Content: i'm really happy that i got it the only thing wrong is now to change it. but other then that but it.

Reviews.Title: I did not purch this product I only enquired about oit on line
Reviews.Author: Steven Stein "steven13"
Reviews.Content: I did not purchase this product I only inquired about it. I view several Nikon cameras, this was only one of many.

Reviews.Title: Poor Focus
Reviews.Author: Jdkk
Reviews.Content: I choose this camera because it has the special zoom lens & I was disapointed because it does'ntfocus up-close at all...must be damaged. But it does take nice "normal" pictures that are far away.

Reviews.Title: A ONVENIENT EASY TO USE DIGTALI CAMERA- COMPETITIVELY PRICED
Reviews.Author: Wes Rice
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Up-to-date touch screen technology with good picture download software.Clear on-camera display. One of the best digital cameras for the price and I've used several other alternves.Does need a memory card for typical use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: DavidH "DavidH"
Reviews.Content: I have had Coolpix cameras at work for years so I was familiar with them.  I bought this one when I retired.  Great value camera, takes excellent pics, easy to use.  I wish the menu selection, for choosing different presets, used English abbreviations of some sort over the little picture icons, there are many of them and always hard to remember which are which.  There is a menu to help with that but you have to flip back and forth to use it.  Other than that it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: It was okay
Reviews.Author: Hailey M
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera not off amazon but I do own it I find it takes pretty good pictures outdoors not the best quality but still pretty good and then once I try indoor pictures its orange and very off colored ive tried fixing the lighting and going into settings and it still is poor quality both color and clearness wise!

Reviews.Title: Works Great!!
Reviews.Author: Beverly Wallerius
Reviews.Content: Just used it yesterday.  My grandson has a project from school and I have to take pictures of this character with me at my job and send it to him.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and easy to carry.
Reviews.Author: Marissa
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom after the screen of her Sony camera burnt out.This camera is awesome! It takes great shots and the touch screen is easy to use. It even includes a stylus. It's a great camera to throw in your bag and bring along on vacations.

Reviews.Title: Big Mistake
Reviews.Author: EarthMother
Reviews.Content: I made several mistakes but the first one was purchasing this camera before reading the reviews. Now its too late to use whatever warranty was offered. I used the camera for approximately four months, taking only a handful of pictures over that period. I charged the battery but the camera would not turn on. I tried everything but no power.....frozen. Had I read the reviews first I wouldn't be stuck with this POS because many reviewers stated that the problem is related to the lens mechanism.  I had a similar problem with a digital Olympus, but I had used that camera consistenly for 4 years, still shots and video, before it froze. Warning: Do not buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: Major quality issues
Reviews.Author: Cameron
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera and within 10-15 pictures it refused to charge or turn on. I purchased a new battery and the problem persisted. I purchased a third party charger thinking that was the problem, again no luck. I returned it to the store where a technician and I tried to troubleshoot the problem, only to give up after 20+ min of swapping out different batteries, chargers etc. Eventually, the store decided to fully replace the camera. So new camera in hand, I managed to get about 50+ more pictures before the optical zoom decided to jam every time I try to turn it on. When I power the camera on it flashes "lens error" and automatically shuts down. The camera is still under warranty and I am sure the store would be willing to replace it for me, but frankly i'd rather not bother. It's going in the trash were it belongs and if i ever give another second of time to another Nikon product it will be only to help dissuade anyone form purchasing any of their cameras, simply not worth the plastic they are made of.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Rachel P. Blackham "midwayrachel"
Reviews.Content: My daughter bought this to replace the gift camera that she had lost on a hike. Easy to us end good picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Zoom stuck in "on" position - Nikon was rude and will not fix it
Reviews.Author: Limonatta
Reviews.Content: The camera automatically zooms all the way in when you turn it on. After resetting the camera and doing all the "tricks" that Nikon tech support told me to do, the camera is still broken. Although under warranty, they demand payment for repair. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE NIKON! You just lost a customer.

Reviews.Title: Orange pics, well now....
Reviews.Author: Skip
Reviews.Content: The little camera takes good pics when out of doors, but when I am photographing inside the pics turn orange and dull colors. What am I doing wrong??? It was alright when I first purchased it but atfer a  few months the indoor colors changed and that was and is less than pleasing. I think I need another camera one that is more reliable.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S4100 14 MP
Reviews.Author: comingso
Reviews.Content: Nikon COOLPIX S4100 14 MP... Digital Camera with 5x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical... Exellent! articulo como nuevo y en exelentes condiciones!

Reviews.Title: No problem, nice camera
Reviews.Author: gulrea
Reviews.Content: It has been a while since I bought this camera. Ive used for more than a year and gave it to my mother now. Color is nice, battery is durable. It met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Cool pix s4100
Reviews.Author: Roy D. Manuszak "batt3"
Reviews.Content: Works as expected, very nice point & shoot for the price,no complaints. Would recommend this camera to my friends. Well worth the money

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: brendalee fox
Reviews.Content: i have read a lot of hate on this camera but i dont see it.  it is an amazing camera and i love how slim and fast it worksthe clarity  of the picture itself is amazing as well as moving pictures.  i am a happy customer

Reviews.Title: Nice model, but very defective
Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: When I first got this particular model camera (around April 2011), it was to replace my Nikon COOLPIX S3000 (when it suffered the lens error at the time).  Resolution was nice and it was cool to use touchscreen.  However, one of the first problems (at least when I first received) was the fact when it tried playing back 720p videos it recorded, it either got choppy or nearly froze.  Only way to play such videos back was on a computer or another camera (if supported).A few months to maybe a year later, it too suffered the lens error.  Fortunately, I was able to correct it (and the S3000 model I thought got lens damage).  Later on in its lifespan, it was also beginning to suffer a charging problem (others have mentioned).  Turns out it wasn't the charging at all that had issues, but rather it eats batteries very rapidly (even when off!). Got new batteries that were supposed to last longer (more amps available), but got drained as well.In the S3000 model, however, I have kept batteries (no charging) in there for months and still carry a charge.  Of course, they drain batteries when not in use, but usually slowly.  Not so with the S4100.Another problem I noticed was the fact it was beginning to have delays in picture taking.  When I just recently used my S3000 I got back in June 2010, it was still very efficient at taking pictures.  Never had to replace the battery for it either.  When I had the lens error originally on the S3000 model, I dropped it on concrete though with no screen damage. Unfortunately, my S4100's screen was destroyed/damaged just recently due to mere bumping.  Nikon cameras are normally very good, but steer clear from this model.

Reviews.Title: Mothers Day Present
Reviews.Author: Calley brewer
Reviews.Content: We all chipped in and got my grandmother a camera for mothers day. She absolutely loves it. Awesome pics and little to figure out. trust me, if my 80 yr old grandma can do it you can too. the touch screen is her favorite. I have a Nikon J1 ( I swear by Nikons) and love it, but it take a while to get used to the J1, Her camera is slim and way easy to handle. Great Buy, (my idea, so I am now the favorite grandkid.)

Reviews.Title: Excellent digital camera!
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: I read a couple reviews on this camera was a little hesitant at first people posted that battery wont stay charge and other problems. So not true! I have had this camera for a week now and its is amazing! Beautiful pictures and more. I still only charge the battery once still going strong I take pictures everyday. Fast delivery and brand new with all manuals and cords VERY HAPPY!

Reviews.Title: My wife loves it
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Barnett "Michael J Barnett"
Reviews.Content: This is a very reliable camera that delivers very good pictures.  The only improvement would be to increase the optical zoom.

Reviews.Title: Lens mechanism broken again
Reviews.Author: featherlou
Reviews.Content: We've had the Nikon Coolpix S4100 for 15 months - we had the broken lens unit fixed for the first time after six months. At 15 months, the lens unit is broken again (it won't extend and retract the lens), and now it is out of warranty.The camera does not take pictures very well close up or far away, either (even when the lens unit IS working!).

Reviews.Title: worked but is slowly declining
Reviews.Author: J. hornberger "jenna"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for over two years and it worked fine until a couple weeks ago, the zoom was good and the focusing was okay, but like i said a couple weeks ago the video did not work the pictures came out blurry every time no matter what setting i put it on, my friends even tried to get it to work bu to no avail, bummer, now it wont even load up pics onto my computer, charging was great but quality not so good :(

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: This is a very user friendly camera .  It is compatible with my dell all in one scanner. I am pleased with this purchase. Great pictures every time.

Reviews.Title: Worst digital camera ever owned
Reviews.Author: sarahmw
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift and at first I loved everything about it from the touch screen to the picture quality. However, in the year that I have owned it, it has had more problems than it is worth.  It had to be sent away for repairs that took a month, only for it to come back and have the same problem again, only now the camera is out of warranty. Beware of this particular product. If you get even the smallest amount of dirt in the lens the camera will be rendered useless. The touch screen leaves a lot to be desired and as time went on the picture quality became less desirable. I take better pictures on my cell phone! Not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: Calebzzz
Reviews.Content: I bought my camera used. It shipped super fast, but when it arrived it was in Japanese. But I easily figured out how to change it to English. The pictures it takes are beautiful. And the purple color is EPIC. I suggest this camera to everyone. It's touch screen and comes with a little stylus so you don't scratch the scree. It can take quite a beating since I've dropped it a few times. ALWAYS WEAR THE WRIST STRAP!!!

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: andrea M.
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon Coolpix S4100 from Target on November 10, 2011.  I noticed a problem with my photos in March of this year, 2013, sixteen months after purchase. Some look like they are double exposures and some have weird colors to them. I was told this was either a lense or shutter problem. I contacted Nikon and there was nothing they could do except to charge me to send the camera to have a look at it and then charge me again to fix it. They only give a year warranty and since I didn't take out an extended plan I am out of luck. I was told it would probably cost more to have it fixed than to buy a new camera. I keep my camera in a case and do not abuse my possessions.  I am completely disappointed in a camera company that used to have a great reputation. I will never again purchase a Nikon product.

Reviews.Title: camara nikon
Reviews.Author: Ximena LA
Reviews.Content: Excelente, vino antes de la fecha prevista, y ademas excelente camara, yo les ecribi varios correos de dudas qeu tenia y ellos muy amable me respondieron cada correo, ademas de excelente camara tambien posee excellente precio, estoy muy satisfecha por la compra de esta camara

Reviews.Title: Great portable point and click camera.
Reviews.Author: Blaise Leal
Reviews.Content: Great little point and click camera. It has a pretty nice sized LCD screen on the back for easy touch screen navigation. Best camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen Earley
Reviews.Content: very good and works well, but battery life is limited even when not in use. Cannot be left in storage and used without charging.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S4100 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical.
Reviews.Author: Andrey Kvasov
Reviews.Content: Pretty good camera for this money.I bought as a gift for my friend. And I think he like it pretty much.

Reviews.Title: Nice present.
Reviews.Author: Phillip A. Troehler
Reviews.Content: Got for my wife.  She loves it and it takes great pictures.  She always wanted one like this and it was a good buy.

Reviews.Title: a good buy
Reviews.Author: chocolatathunder
Reviews.Content: get this one befor they are all gone kdf ljg gj ifgj dijg  iejgwi erjgqiorfj igweioj id j kldfj fj gj kgdji wejfgoi  iog ji kif jiojg; khbiuer;w5t'q pe ee

Reviews.Title: Glad I bought it.
Reviews.Author: CharlesHelderman
Reviews.Content: It takes great pics.  Small but large view screen which is a big plus for me.  Auto feature works great.

Reviews.Title: didn't last
Reviews.Author: MsButtascotchbaby
Reviews.Content: didn't last six months. Nikon are good for the orginal ones with the big lens but the small digital cameras are crappy.

Reviews.Title: Wolf in sheep's clothing!!
Reviews.Author: Jalisa M "JLSA"
Reviews.Content: First off let me state that I DID NOT purchase this product from Amazon but rather I got one as a Christmas gift and have been using it for a 2yrs. I'm a semi-pro photographer and I own 3 other cameras ( 1 canon p&s; included) along with this camera. When I first got this camera I was trilled by the 14MP and the touch screen capabilities. It was my first Nikon as well since I AM A CANON FAN HEAD.During my first few photos I tested all the features and different effects etc. until I began noticing that when zoomed in the photos were fussy and unpleasant to look at. It was nasty when it came to providing sharp edges and mostly required the flash to assist in keeping images sharp - not razor sharp, but sharp. The flash was another headache it was ridiculous, causing red eyes everywhere. But depending on the scene it would light very nicely. The HD 720p video capabilities is nothing to shout about, as that too was a unsuccessful function on Nikon's part. I would take videos and when I upload them on the PC to edit them they would lag and sometimes be distorted. Zooming in was a waste of time as the images would be horrifying. The touch screen was slow to react which was a major turn off. Playback lags and having to slide through pictures sometimes you miss the photo you really want to get to. The battery I find, last pretty long FOR ME; as I don't use it(the camera) on a major scale. With that is said I'm looking to sell this Nikon and buy a Canon bridge camera. The ONE TIME I decided to give Nikon a chance I was fooled!In comparison to the Canon P&S; I mentioned earlier, this Nikon is only 4 more mega-pixels stronger than my canon and the HD Video and touch screen are the only functions my dear Canon p&s; doesn't have other than that my 3 yr old canon p&s; still beats out this Nikon!I would not recommend this product to anyone. Whether it's for a teen just looking to get some quick flicks or a pro.

Reviews.Title: RECIBIDO
Reviews.Author: Adelis Alvarado
Reviews.Content: EXCELENTE VENDEDOR REALIZARE MAS COMPRAS EN EL FUTURO, QUEDE SATISFECHO CON EL PRODUCTO Y HARE RECOMENDACIONES A TODOS LOS AMIGOS

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix Camera
Reviews.Author: John W. Hornsby
Reviews.Content: I bought this item for my granddaughter and she is very pleased with it.My wife and I have used the camera on several occasions and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: so not worth it
Reviews.Author: Mcca
Reviews.Content: Oh this camera sucks big time! so frustrated with it I could toss it across the room. No need to go into full detail because I'm having the same problem everyone else is having. "IT WON'T CHARGE"

Reviews.Title: made a great gift
Reviews.Author: tomcat
Reviews.Content: What a nice camera for the price it's a birtday my girlfreind will remember for a long time to come

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: David C. Curran
Reviews.Content: Really enjoy useing this camera, was a great buy....has alot of nice features.Easy to use..Nice and compact, is easy to carry around.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures.
Reviews.Author: bikerted
Reviews.Content: I like Nikon cameras.  This one is no exception.  Red was on sale for less than half regular price.  It has some kind of coating on it that makes it feel rubbery.  I acturally like it.

Reviews.Title: ok camera.
Reviews.Author: amanda
Reviews.Content: id say this camera was great but image quality is iffy. it takes a lot of work and repeated tries at various distances to get a perfectly clear photo of something still.people and pets i guess it works fine but dont expect quality shots that are good enough for large prints. the larger your print the more obvious flaws begin to become like graininess and a lack of clarity.never had problems charging this camera really.the touch screen is pretty unresponsive to touch but works dandy with the stylus. just dont lose that little stylus and you'd be good.

Reviews.Title: Gift for Xmas
Reviews.Author: yarisel aquino
Reviews.Content: The camera was a t a great price for everything that it brings, I bought it as a gift and the one I gave it to loves it.

Reviews.Title: bueno
Reviews.Author: Neira
Reviews.Content: buenas noches la compra todo fue muy rapido y sin ningun problama y en excelentes condiciones y llego a tiempo gracias

Reviews.Title: great!!
Reviews.Author: Tabitha Olicshevis
Reviews.Content: I love this product...Fast track and delivery...I had one just like it ,but I sit on it and it broke .I bought one just like it ,because it's really good so my mom wouldnt find out about the broken one.It's auto config is a little bit different from the first one ,because sometimes it seems to loose its configuration... but no big deal,

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: CCShopper
Reviews.Content: This device is stunning and beautiful. The pictures come out beautiful and the device is easy to understand and maneuver. I would recommend it for anyone who is an amateur photographer and who just wants a camera to capture every day moments.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M. Niles "DigiManipulation.com"
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old bought this camera with her saved up birthday money. She LOVES it. It is a very nice little camera, works great, lots of features but not to difficult for her to use. I'd by one for myself - it takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Won't shoot 720P, low battery life.
Reviews.Author: Hunter C_
Reviews.Content: I don't know why it will not let me select the 720P option, but it isn't a great camera anyways. The pictures nearly always end up shakey.

Reviews.Title: nikon camera
Reviews.Author: Lars E. Sandstrom
Reviews.Content: love love love this camera. i had one and i broke the screen. i had to have another one just like it. was very happy to find one. shipment arrived very promptly. thank you

Reviews.Title: Real good camera
Reviews.Author: Singh
Reviews.Content: This camera full my expectations because I got it in good price plus is a Nikon,  best cameras in the world.I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: shame product
Reviews.Author: maria
Reviews.Content: mine was not bought on amazon,but i have pretty much the same issues as the reviews before me.camera wont charge through computer or wall charger after 5 months, i thought it was the cord but it washnt.as for pictures quality, belive it or not my ooooold (2006 year) casio Casio EX-S600 was taking better pics on natural light.is impossible to take non blurry pics without the flash no matter what. i have lost so many good picture moments with my kidsdue to a camera that is power dead and when it washnt the pictures taken were a shame.dont buy it.hope this review helps someone from disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!!
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Just what the wife was looking for.. Small and compact enough to carry around, powerful enough to take beautiful pictures!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING CAMERA
Reviews.Author: GODDESS
Reviews.Content: Was as described. the camera it self was brand new and the quality of the pictures ive taken since ive gotten it are amazing im glad that i got the camera

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S4100
Reviews.Author: Lionel Messi
