Reviews.Content: I think this is a great camera. It takes good pictures day/night. The screen is really clear and takes really quickly, it helped me to take pictures of supercars in London and Paris and Munich, Germany. I is pretty durable too. All in all the Nikon Coolpix S4100 is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: best deal ever! great camera
Reviews.Author: RUDY
Reviews.Content: My husband could not believe the great work this camera does.He does art work and show cars.the detail in the Picture for this little camera is amazing.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: hooville
Reviews.Content: this is a great product,easy to use and has a lot of feathures and great price. very nice pics and large screen and zoom in on things very close love it , hooville

Reviews.Title: Cool Pix
Reviews.Author: smc
Reviews.Content: I like that this camera has the stylus, however i would still like the option of using a button in case the touch feature messes up. Other than that i enjoy my camera

Reviews.Title: Defective.
Reviews.Author: Victoria J. Heil
Reviews.Content: Couldn't transfer pictures to my computer because wrong connector included (instead of USB-to-custom-Nikon-USB, some kind of custom-Nikon-USB-to-GOK-dual-AV-plugs). Couldn't use USB-to-micro-USB connector because of custom-Nikon-USB form factor.

Reviews.Title: As Ordered
Reviews.Author: N. Christianson
Reviews.Content: This product came as advertized. It is the best camera under $100.00. It needs a closeup lens. I think Nikon makes the best cameras peorid.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Jose Gabriel Espinoza "gabriele"
Reviews.Content: Great pictures, easy to use.  However, sometimes there's a problem with it not charging the battery; here's the solution, do not let the battery go empty and keep the camera always plugged in (it won't overcharge it), or buy a separate charger.  At least for me, the picture quality is worth leaving it plugged all the time.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Kris5747
Reviews.Content: I really like this model camera. It's user friendly, and easy to transfer pictures to my pc. The quality of the pictures is great, too!

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: Mderr
Reviews.Content: We received this camera just over a year ago and are satisfied with the picture quality. We have a 4 year old that wont sit still so its nice to pull it out snap a picture and throw it in your pocket and not worry about it. The only thing that I am not to keen on is when the battery gets low the pictures seem to get a little fuzzy but once you charge it back up their fine.

Reviews.Title: Nice on day light photo, very bad for night or low light photograpjy
Reviews.Author: Edward
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife on a vacations trip, the camera is very lightweight which I liked, on day light it can take nice shoots, however; for low light, the camera is a dissarter, I use Nikon since 2010 have had D3000 and D7000 DSRL and I know how to shoot in low light, also the touch screen capability is not confortable nos easy to use. Returned it and got a Sony Cibershot WD570. Much better in my opinion

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: Thompson
Reviews.Content: Used the camera once, then when I tried to charge the battery it wouldn't. Camera wouldn't even turn on. Called customer service and they want you to pay to send it to them.  Of course the warrenty doesn't cover the battery (which from reading other reviews is the problem)  What a piece of crap!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: brian d king
Reviews.Content: This a great little camera. Does everything you need for basic picture taking and then some. Easy to use. I first got one at work and liked it so much that I went and bought one for myself. I have a Sony  point and shoot and a Sony digital SLR with different lens and I seem to use this little Nokion for just about everything.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Perla Koziner
Reviews.Content: We got the Camera, opened it, started using it, and when we tried to re charge the battery for the second time, it doesn't work, the battery cannot be re charged due to a faulty camera or battery. So far we have not heard back from the manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Ok pictures, bad quality camaera
Reviews.Author: RC
Reviews.Content: The camera took pictures that were ok, nothing spectacular or special.  But within a month of having the camera, and not using it that much, the USB connector on the camera end broke.  The USB could no longer be connected to the camera, and therefore the battery could no longer be charged.  I now have a useless piece of crap sitting around my house.  And the camera only comes with a 30 return policy, and of course it broke just after 30 days.  Do not buy your camera off of Amazon and do not buy this camera.  Spend a little extra money to get a sturdy camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but buy an external battery charger.
Reviews.Author: megan knudstrup
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a year ago and I love it. The pictures are very good quality and the battery life is very long. I have taken it on quite a few vacations and have found it to be very resilient. It has great options and modes, and they all work very well. The firework mode is my favorite, as the colors are brilliant and the pictures take almost instantaneously.I have had one problem with this camera, and have had the same thing happen twice. when I bought this camera one of my complaints was that it did not come with an external battery charger and that you had to plug the whole camera in to get it to charge. I plugged it into the car outlet, and it totally fried the camera. I found this strange and so replaced the camera with the same one, as it was still under the store warranty. Recently I tried to plug it into the car again and the camera wouldn't charge. I will tell everyone who buys this camera to also buy the optional battery kit with charger and extra battery and to never plug the camera into the car. I love this camera and wouldn't trade it for any other point-and-shoot.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Lilly
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. It is an attractive piece of equipment that slides very easily into a purse or pocket so you are always ready to take that shot. It is easy to operate, you can do almost anything right from the touch screen. It takes great pictures too. I give this a big thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S4100
Reviews.Author: D. Holmes
Reviews.Content: Have never had a Nikon Camera, but a friend bought one recently and really likes it, so when I needed a new camera I went to the Nikon brand.  I really love my new camera, easy to use, compact and love that it's rechargable. I recommend getting a little case for it to protect the screen.

Reviews.Title: A great camera with outstanding image stabilization.
Reviews.Author: S. A. ROBBINS "shirley_rw"
Reviews.Content: I now have 5 digital cameras. I bought this Nikon because of the excellent image stabilization. Works better than any other camera that I have and the pictures always come out excellent. Very easy to use with a large display touch screen.I also like all the features as this is a well thought out camera. I like the way the lens disappears into the camera and that keeps the lens clean and protects it. The power on button is well designed so that it won't be accidentally turned on. I also like that you do not have to turn the camera on in order to transfer photos to your PC. Just plugging in the USB cable activates the Nikon software on the PC to allow transfer. You can then look at the images and decide what to transfer.The color quality looks very real and bright. The S4100 even takes excellent photos in low light conditions without the flash, but the photo sharpness will not be as good. Battery life appears to be good and you can charge the camera battery in the camera from any USB port.Overall a very inexpensive compact camera with great stabilization and excellent photo results.

Reviews.Title: Horrible VIDEO.
Reviews.Author: MOONbear
Reviews.Content: I have been an AVID Sony user for the last few years. I love the cybershot line, but I have a mac. These two devices don't play well together if you get me. So I thought "Hey! I know I will try Nikon because it's well known they make great lenses!" Well too-da-lee-do batman! Low and behold this camera turned into a bloody nightmare!!!!1. The "720hd" is crap! After recording on that setting and viewing playback on my mac the image was grainy and EXTREMELY pixelated. I think Nikon is pulling the wool over consumers eyes with this one folks.2. The interface is horrible! It looks like an Olympus display from the early 2000's. It's awful.3. It doesn't even take a decent picture. Especially inside a house at night. It has a hard time with white balance and focus under artificial light.Do yourself a favor and get something that a majority of consumers have given at least a 4 or 5 star rating to. Anything below a 4 is just trash. I've learned my lesson. This is a really disappointing camera. Looks like I have to go back to Sony and deal with the long uploads/transfers from camera to computer. yuck.

Reviews.Title: Ok for taking pictures
Reviews.Author: cesar
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take pictures and record some family events. I had an 8GB SD card that I'd used on diff cameras but when I used it on this nikon it sucked. The camera would only record for 8minutes at a time before stopping. I had to keep pressing record every 8 minutes which got kind of annoying. Another problem is that it didn't even fully use the 8GB SD card. The camera would record for max 20 minutes before refusing to record and stating the memory was full. An 8GB card is good for at least one or two hours. I formatted the card to see if that was the problem but it wasn't. There was no setting on the camera that allowed to change the receding time. If you want this camera purely for pics then it's ok. But I suggest you look elsewhere if you wan to do some recording. I returned mine.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Vicki Arven
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in camera.  Bought because my daughter-in-law had the model prior to this one that took excellent pictures.  Every picture on this one has turned out blurry and the battery is already dead.  Would NOT recommend.  Have only had it a little over a month.  Waste of money!  Was trying to save some money, but found that Best Buy and Target had it for the same price as Amazon.  VERY VERY disappointed.

Reviews.Title: It's a good camera and update to date
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: The camera is a good camera, and it's a good bang for it's buck but the screen on the camera is really soft. I just have to get some type of screen protector. Other than that it's pretty high quality.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: CoachKWJ
Reviews.Content: Within a month of purchase, the inner lense on this cracked while it was in my shirt pocket. Tried to contact Customer Service on several occasions with no luck. What a joke. Even before it craked, the pictures were so/so.I've had Fuji and Cannon cameras that I actually dropped and no harm resulted. What a piece of junk.I called the store where I bought it and they said bring it in and they would take a look at it. The service tech predicted exactly whay happened. They sent it to Nikon and Nikon did nothing under warranty. Claimed misuse. The tech said he had a Nikon do the same thing to him when he put a Nikon camera in his pants pocket. He said they have a tendency to twist and the lense cracks.No more Nikons for me! If I could rate zero stars for total experience with $180.00 camera, I would.

Reviews.Title: Total piece of jerk!
Reviews.Author: pipi
Reviews.Content: I bought a Nikon Coolpix S4100 for my travel abroad.  This is my 5th Nikon camera and third digital. However, it turned to be a total piece of jerk! The lens failed on the 3rd day of my trip. The motor was not able to open/close the lens completely while turn on/off. Can't focus. Since I came back 1 month after purchase, could not return it. and don't think worth to send it in for repair.

Reviews.Title: No pix -- battery won't charge!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Like other customers, i took about 200 pictures, then the battery died.  it won't recharge.  customer support said "it's probably a battery problem" so i bought a new battery.  but it died after another 200 pictures and won't recharge.  2 dead batteries, one dead camera, no support, wish i bought a different camera.

Reviews.Title: I HATE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Just a Blur!
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera ever.  Got it for Chrismas after I sat on my Canon one too many times, and have been so disappointed ever since.  Especially bummed because the first 6 months of my daughters life have been photographed by this horrible camera.  Almost every picture is blurry.  The colors are horrible.  The touch screen is non responsive and only works with the pen.  I have missed so many special moments because by the time the darn thing actually takes the picture, the moment has passed.  There are too many features, and it doesn't matter anyways because none of them improve the picture quality.  I want my Canon Powershot back! :(

Reviews.Title: say your money
Reviews.Author: jackie tegenkamp
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera I could keep in my purse for whenever I needed to take pictures. This camera is kept in the junk drawer! Every picture is blurry. Worst camera ever!

Reviews.Title: Sleek and awesome...small compact & beautiful images
Reviews.Author: jack
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see my camera so slim...for moments i hold it just to confirm its that slim and hot red color oHHH !! making my fiance crazy everytime I click her pic..its a great camera good looks loaded features and easy to carry for all vacation...

Reviews.Title: Nice easy pocket camera
Reviews.Author: T Arget
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera without much research.  A camera store manager recommended it.  I purchased this and, yes, it took some trial and error to find my "groove" with it but it has been producing some fine shots.  It's not too delicate either:  last night I was in a club and it fell out of my pocket, getting kicked a couple of times before I could pick it up. The battery compartment had opened but the picture card stayed securely in place - whew!  Everything still works, just some light scuff marks and my pictures were not lost.For the money I think this is a fine pocket camera.  Touch screen takes some getting used to but it means fewer buttons to figure out (and less to break).  I like it already.

Reviews.Title: Great For Personal Enjoyment
Reviews.Author: Cougars!
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for about a year now, and as a personal camera for taking pictures at parties and such, I love it. This is a pretty great camera for any amateur wanting to take some fun, casual pictures with friends. It's relatively user friendly and takes decent pictures. However, I would not recommend this camera for anyone interested in serious photography; the zoom isn't that great, pictures are easily blurred, and the touch screen can sometimes be a bit, well, touchy. Depending on your needs and wants in a personal camera, this one could be a great fit.

Reviews.Title: not bad despite what others say.
Reviews.Author: flipfury
Reviews.Content: i just kinda bought this on a whim. bought it for my girlfriend on her birthday. i got it for a good price too. which is funny because even the black friday price for this camera was still more than what i paid. it takes nice pictures and there are a lot of differnt scene settings you can use, that will change the look of your photo. it records 720 HD videos. a  lot of reviews said that it would just quite charging or it just stop taking the charge. but mine works fine. i make sure when i do charge that i don't charge it for more than a couple of hours. there was a few times i let it charge for longer and nothing seemed to go wrong. sometimes when starting it up its nice to just let it warm up for a sec. 'cause it might take a few seconds to take the picture if your just trying to snap away for a photo. the zoom works nice.a lot of people said the touchscreen was really touchy and that it worked better using your fingernail. it does come with a little plastic pointer pen deal that attaches to string/leash on your camera, which is supposed to be use on the touch screen. makes everything a little easier. using your finger isn't that bad at all though. its a good camera, takes good pictures, and just play with scene settings to see what you like.

Reviews.Content: Gerat camera value ! too small 4 my big hands, and the zoom is poor. The quality and functionality is Nikon expected. Bottom line it is a great all around inexpensive camera !Jerry shooting in Hawaii

Reviews.Title: Shutter broke on 2nd day
Reviews.Author: ny76
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed that the shutter would not close properly starting on the 2nd day of purchase and does not Nikon offer an international warranty on digital cameras. I need to use the camera outside the USA (bought it from Amazon USA).

Reviews.Title: Not the Camera you want
Reviews.Author: vbdenny
Reviews.Content: I bought this thing when my Canon SD900 wore out. If you are a simple snapshotter that this will suffice however if you are planning to take VIDEO, steer far away from the Nikon. Using the same chips that worked fine and new chips this camera has a chronic problem of saying "THIS CARD CANNOT BE READ" about 80% of the time when you try to take video. Unlike the Canon, there is no apparent way to do a low level format on the chips making this camera useless for my purposes. Luckily it only cost me $110 so I won't feel to bad about ditching the thing.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: argee
Reviews.Content: Used the camera a couple of times, turning off if I wasn't going to take more shots in the next few minutes.  After turning on and off a few times, the camera refused to close, and made a grinding noise.  After grinding for a while, it finally closed, but then it wouldn't open again.  Ironically, we also have a year-old version of the camera, which then started to do the same thing!  Bottom line: the pictures taken are nice, the camera is small and convenient, but reliability is way below par.

Reviews.Content: Have never bought a Nikon camera and this will be the last!!  The battery will not charge with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Touch Screen Doesn't Work!

Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and tried it out for less than an hour and couldn't not operate it. The touchscreen is not very responsive and the controls are difficult to work with. The pictures that I took we're not clear. I would not recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Content: No mention was made in the description that the lens does not close completely when you shut the camera off.This is deceptive.The seller described the item as "very good".It is not "very good".

Reviews.Title: No photo op
Reviews.Author: Offgrid
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. Lens failed to operate properly most of the time, so I returned it within a week. Time to explore other options.

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera
Reviews.Author: Michelle Hewitt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera three months ago. I wanted it as a back up for my Cannon camera. I was not looking for anything very special. I wanted very basic photo and video capability. This appeared to do that.When I got it out of the box and tried it for the first time the touch screen was difficult to navigate, but I did get used to it. Figuring out the symbols for the settings was not intuative and the user guide with the camera is useless. After some trouble-shooting, I was able to figure out how to get the settings to work as I like them to work. The picture quality lacked though and their automatic settings were green or yellow and I could not figure out how to get a better light balance on this camera.Then, I took this camera on vacation. I attempted to fully charge the battery before leaving. It did not fully charge. I took the charging cord that came with the camera with to charge while on vacation. It still did not charge. After trying to charge it multiple times now unsuccessfully, the battery is completely exhausted and will not work. I am reluctant to buy another rechargable battery for this camera because from what I am now reading about this camera, the problem will not be fixed.I am currently trying to work with Nikon to resolve this issue, but I do not anticipate I will have a functioning camera at the end of this frustration.So, if you have $100 to throw away on a product, this one will gladly take it. I will not be buying another Nikon in my lifetime. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Resistive touch technology is the worst
Reviews.Author: Daniel Mansel
Reviews.Content: I have pretty limited experience with this camera as it was purchased as a gift for my mother but I have played around with it a few times when I didn't have my DSLR handy. The camera takes solif images for a point and shoot camera, comes with everything you need, and looks relatively nice. One of the greatest features of the camera is that it uses optical zoom most as opposed to digital zoom. This allows you to take closer photos without sacrificing the quality of the image.The main thing that makes me despise this camera though is the resistive touch screen they used on the back LCD. For those who aren't aware there are two types of touch screens that are commonly used resistive, and capacitive. A capacitive touch screen can sense electrical impulses that are released by your body when it comes in contact with anything. These are the touch screens most of us know and love as they are present on our smart phones, ipads, tablets, and other devices. Resistive on the other hand works as it sounds like it would, by requiring pressure to actually be exerted on the screen to react to the touch. This system has become a lot less popular as the screens that require pressure also tend to break a lot more quickly because of all the pushing. I would easily overlook all of that outdated technology save for one huge flaw in it's use... the pressure needed to activate any of the buttons is way more than I feel comfortable using and often doesn't work properly.That said the camera does come with a mini stylus tool to assist in pressing the screen more easily but the idea that someone must have a stylus to press the buttons seems too inconvenient for my liking.

Reviews.Title: Flashy but mediocre
Reviews.Author: DMW
Reviews.Content: The plum color is cute, the touch screen is exciting but not really an improvement over buttons for navigating menus more easily . . . Quality of photos is not great; other cameras I have used (slightly more expensive) have much better vibration reduction for low-light. My biggest complaint, however, is the amount of time it takes between turning the camera on and being able to take a picture - you have to press the button twice, which means that awesome thing you wanted to catch may be lost forever. Perhaps there is a way to get around this but I'm not keeping this long enough to find out.

Reviews.Title: great tiny camera
Reviews.Author: doris glenn
Reviews.Content: this little camera is great. it has many features that i am too dumb to use, but the basic functions that i am capable of using are very simple . the touch screen works great with the stilus

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: bamf
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  It came quickly to my house, too.  Easy to use, takes great pictures.  I would recomend this product to a friend (I already have).

Reviews.Title: ok, if you dont have high expectations
Reviews.Author: J. Miller
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera with high hopes.  I love Nikon and it took great pics in the store.  It has a bit of a delay on it from oushing the button to it actually taking the picture.  The flash is a double flash and snaps the picture on the second flash.  This is a problem since I am takin gpics of kids and after the first flash they think I have taken the pic and are ready to move on.  So I have a lot of moving pictures, which, may I add were blurry ( and the flash was on).  Your subject has to stay VERY still for the pic to turn out and be somewhat clear.  I decided to return it and buy a better model and ended up with the Nikon s8200.  worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: this camera is trash. please dont waste the money!
Reviews.Author: applek730
Reviews.Content: I WILL NEVER BUY NIKON AGAIN. IT IS OVEPRICED TRASH.Sadly, I DID NOT look into the reviews for this camera before I purchased. I even bought it at Best Buy and spent almost 200 on the garbage. I have had this camera for 3 months. I first ran into the problem of it not charging about 1.5 months in. I simply replaced it with the backup battery that I bought with the camera bundle. I then began having troubles actually taking a picture, the response time was getting longer and longer, (and when you are trying to take pics of a one year old running around it gets very frustrating). Finally, a week ago I took it out to get a few pics and the only button that worked was the power button.... I tried to turn it off, it would not, I had to take the battery out. As the camera turned off the lens would not retract, it just kept clicking. This camera is trash in my oppinion, I have sent it in to be repaired but they tell me it is going to be atleast 3 weeks. Definitely not worth my time OR money. I feel so angry and foolish for buying this useless piece of garbage.

Reviews.Title: poor made and damaged
Reviews.Author: dolphiness2010
Reviews.Content: I ordered this as a gift. The first one came with a huge crack down the center of the lens. I called to get replaced and the second one came with 2 huge pieces broken off. Please make this right . I would like to have a 3rd one but please make sure you send a good one otherwise refund my money. I have no product and I hope you make this right.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy!!! Broken Within 4 Months!!!
Reviews.Author: Mommyof3
Reviews.Content: This is the most aweful camera ever! I would honestly rate it at "0 Stars" if I could. I paid $179 for this camera at my local Walmart Supercenter. Granted I wish Walmart would take digital camera returns at 6 months instead of 30 days, but you can't blame Walmart for that. I surely can blame Nikon though!The camera worked good, but not great. It does bad when you have good lighting and kids are moving. I have a Nikon D3000 SLR camera, which I love, but it is way too bulky when you want a simple point & shoot camera. Secondly, the touch screen is aweful! It delays all the time and you can only use your fingernails to scroll through the photos. I have 2 kids with 1 on the way and I don't keep my fingernails long b/c I don't want to scratch the kids.After using the camera a few months, I just got used to it and I wish I would have taken it back, but since I had a Nikon SLR camera that works great, I figured another Nikon wouldn't be bad. WRONG!!! After 4 months of use, but not extensive use, the lens broke. It is currently being fixed by Nikon and it is covered under warranty. But contacting Nikon is no better and here is why.I sent the camera in on July 6, 2011 and it got to their service center on July 8, 2011. I had to pay $6 for a different box to ship it in and another $8 just to ship it to them. Then I called them on July 15 and was told the camera had been in the shop for repairs. I called Nikon again on July 18 and was told that the camera just got into the shop and will take 7-10 business days to fix. I complained to them and they said they had several cameras in for service. How can you stand by your product if customers are constantly sending their cameras in for repairs? Considering my camera broke because of a malfunction, I would expect better treatment by the customer service department and definitely should have received the fixed camera by now. It has been 8 days since they received the camera and I probably won't receive it until next week or the week after, which I will be probably delivering my baby by then.Do yourself a favor and buy a Canon instead. I cannot find my purchase receipt for my Nikon D3000 camera and now am scared to use it because if something breaks, I don't know if Nikon will fix it. Then I'm out $500.
